content:
## Beginnings

I.

The first word is always the hardestâ€”
that leap from silence into sound,
from nothing into something,
the moment before becomes after.

II.

Every morning is a small beginning.
Eyes open to light, to possibility,
to the blank page of hours ahead.
We write our days one breath at a time.

III.

The acorn doesn't question its becoming.
It simply splits, sends roots down, reaches up.
Patience is another word for faith
in processes we cannot see.

---
